articles.title: How a growing crisis of loneliness is affecting Americans' health - PBS NewsHour
articles.description: According to the American Psychiatric Association's latest monthly poll, 1 in 3 Americans said they felt lonely at least once a week over the past year, with younger people more likely to report these feelings than other age groups. Edward Garcia, head of the…
articles.content:
Ali Rogin:
Last year, U.S. Surgeon General Vivek Murthy sounded the alarm on the effect chronic loneliness can have on people's health. A report released from his office last spring revealed that so… [+1537 chars]
